607: JOB OVERVIEW In accordance with the process of designing and launching global clinical research studies, perform an independent QC review and ensure study set-up process and procedures are adhered to during the start-up and amendment phase; review of source documentation and database configuration versus sponsor protocol; provision of guidance in the design and organization of project components; develop and maintain best practices within the organization. RESPONSIBILITIES QC of project database(s) and requisition forms versus the sponsor protocol and sponsor specific requirements. Cross functional collaboration to ensure QC reviews reflect current process and quality standards. Work with Set-up Managers and/or Project Managers and/or Set-up Coordinators to resolve problems or quality findings established during the QC review. Oversee and maintain adherence to QC timelines to ensure client needs are met. Analyze and identify quality trends and opportunities for training and process improvements. Collaborate with QC counterparts to ensure global consistency in the study set-up process. Participate in external and internal audits as required. Work performed is in accordance with ICH E6 Guideline for Good Clinical Practice. MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED AND EXPERIENCE Bachelor's Degree Science related field Required. Minimum 2 years of clinical or research industry experience, including 1 year Set-up related and/or Project Management experience. Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Possess strong interpersonal skills for interaction with senior internal stakeholders and on occasion senior members of sponsor organizations and demonstrated ability to meet deadlines. High attention to detail as demonstrated through a track record of achievement in the role of Set-up Manager, Senior Set-up Specialist, Project Manager or equivalent. Demonstrated computer proficiency with Microsoft Office, Q Squared Solutions systems, and ELVIS. Possess an understanding of medical and clinical research terminology. Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment. Knowledge of Set-up Management and/or Project Management processes and terminology would be beneficial. Excellent organizational skills and operational skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills including good command of the English language. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers, and clients.
